Package template

Class AppProperties

java.lang.Object
java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
java.util.Hashtable<Object,Object>
java.util.Properties
template.AppProperties
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Object,Object>
public class AppProperties extends Properties
Application properties. It is the application responsibility to call Note: Do not forget to handle additional properties if a new release is going to be rolled out.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • AppProperties

      public AppProperties(String pathname, boolean useXmlFile) throws Exception
      Construction from file or it takes the default values. The default values are written to the file (and may be overwritten later).
      Parameters:
      pathname - the path to the properties file
      useXmlFile - if true, use loadFromXML(), key/value pairs using load() otherwise
      Throws:
      Exception - on unexpected exceptions

  • Method Details

    • createDefault

      protected void createDefault()
      Creates the default properties. A subclass may overwrite this method.

    • getPathname

      public String getPathname()
      Returns:
      the pathname

    • getPropertyBool

      public boolean getPropertyBool(String key)
      Gets an boolean property (a flag).
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the property
      Returns:
      true id the value is "true", false otherwise

    • getPropertyInt

      public int getPropertyInt(String key)
      Gets an integer property.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the property
      Returns:
      the integer value

    • releaseCheck

      protected void releaseCheck()
      Check if all properties for this release are present, the user may use an older release.

    • setProperty

      public void setProperty(String key, int value)
      Sets an integer property.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the property
      value - the value of the property

    • store

      public void store() throws FileNotFoundException, IOException
      Store the properties to the key/value properties file, to persist them.
      Throws:
      IOException - on IO errors
      FileNotFoundException - if the file was not found

    • storeToXML

      public void storeToXML() throws IOException
      Store the properties to the XML properties file, to persist them.
      Throws:
      IOException - on IO errors
